private_information: I can only manipulate vowel-labeled blocks: A, E, I
I can only move the top block of any stack and only one block at a time
I have access to all stacks on the table and can place moved blocks on top of any stack or on the table
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute to reconfiguring the stacks so the final ordering described in the environment public information is achieved

private_information: I can only manipulate consonant-labeled blocks: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L
I can only move the top block of any stack and only one block at a time
I have access to all stacks on the table and can place moved blocks on top of any stack or on the table
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute to reconfiguring the stacks so the final ordering described in the environment public information is achieved

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents contributions and produce a final PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards solver that achieves the target stacking configuration

public_information: There are 12 uniquely labeled blocks: I, E, H, F, B, A, L, J, K, D, G, C
Blocks are arranged in stacks on a table
Only the top block of a stack can be moved at any time
Agents can move only one block at a time
One agent may only move vowel-labeled blocks A, E, I and the other may only move consonant-labeled blocks B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L

Initial configuration: I is on the table, E is on top of I, H is on the table, F is on the table, B is on top of E, A is on top of B, L is on top of H, J is on top of A, K is on top of F, D is on top of K, G is on top of D, C is on top of J
Goal configuration: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on the table

analysis.system_prompt: You are an agent responsible for the vowel-labeled blocks. Provide an analysis and an ordered list of moves that you can perform given your knowledge constraints. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on moves that involve only vowel blocks and respect the rule that only topmost blocks may be moved and only one block can be moved at a time.
analysis.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. The public information for the environment is: {environment->public_information}. Your private information is: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Your goal is: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Produce a clear analysis of which vowel moves are possible from the initial configuration toward the goal, list proposed move steps that involve only blocks you may manipulate, and indicate any assumptions or missing information needed to complete a full plan. Provide your output as a human readable fragment labeled as vowel_fragment.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an agent responsible for the consonant-labeled blocks. Provide an analysis and an ordered list of moves that you can perform given your knowledge constraints. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on moves that involve only consonant blocks and respect the rule that only topmost blocks may be moved and only one block can be moved at a time.
analysis.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. The public information for the environment is: {environment->public_information}. Your private information is: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Your goal is: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Produce a clear analysis of which consonant moves are possible from the initial configuration toward the goal, list proposed move steps that involve only blocks you may manipulate, and indicate any assumptions or missing information needed to complete a full plan. Provide your output as a human readable fragment labeled as consonant_fragment.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in producing multi-agent PDDL domains and problems targeted for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate partial plan fragments and constraints from multiple agents, keep the agents actions distinct, and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. The environment public information is: {environment->public_information}. You will receive the vowel agent analysis: {vowel_fragment} and the consonant agent analysis: {consonant_fragment}. Integrate those analyses into a single consistent multi-agent PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that achieves the stated goal. Ensure agent capabilities remain distinct in the domain (for example, separate action schemas or agent predicates to indicate which agent may perform which actions). Target the FastDownwards solver when choosing PDDL constructs and provide any required type, predicate, and action definitions. Think step by step and output the PDDL domain and PDDL problem. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
